snippet: The punishments handed down for Sébastien Feller, Arnaud Hauchard and Cyril Marzolo of France close the books on one of the most notorious cheating scandals in the game’s history.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes that World Chess Federation has suspended top French players Sebastien Feller, Arnaud Hauchard and Cyril Marzolo for cheating in 2010 tournaments as part of a conspiracy to help Feller win games.
lead_paragraph: The punishments handed down for Sébastien Feller, Arnaud Hauchard and Cyril Marzolo of France close the books on one of the most notorious cheating scandals in the game’s history.

headline.print_headline: Three Players Suspended For Conspiring to Cheat
headline.seo: Chess: Feller, Hauchard and Marzolo Are Suspended
headline.main: Three Players Suspended for Conspiring to Cheat
